headline: Tim Ryan raises $4.1 million for Senate race in first quarter
author: Julia Manchester
sentences: The nonpartisan Cook Political Report rates the general election race in the state as lean Republican,? but the eventual GOP nominee will first have to get through a crowded and contentious primary.
Ohio Senate candidate and Rep. Tim Ryan (D) raised $4.1 million in the first quarter of the year, marking a record amount raised for a Senate candidate at this point in the midterms cycle.
The congressman is the clear frontrunner in the states Democratic Senate primary, in which Democrats Morgan Harper, Traci Johnson and LaShondra Tinsley are also competing.
The Hill has removed its comment section, as there are many other forums for readers to participate in the conversation.
Last month, Ryan announced plans to invest more than $3 million to support down-ballot Ohio Democrats this cycle.
Five Republicans  businessman Mike Gibbons, former state Treasurer Josh Mandel, author and businessman J.D.
Vance, former state GOP Chairwoman Jane Timken and state Sen. Matt Dolan  are vying for the nomination.
But Ryan already has his sights set on the general election race beyond the May 3rd primary.
According to his campaign, 97 percent of Ryans contributions were $100 or less.
We invite you to join the discussion on Facebook and Twitter.
Ryans campaign also saw 29,239 new donors this quarter.
Ryans campaign currently has $6.4 million in the bank.
Additionally, he launched a $3.3 million ad buy.
Rob Portman (R-Ohio) in the Buckeye State.
Ryan is running to replace retiring Sen.
